name: Andel's Hotel & Suites Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: A 20 minute car ride into town booked through the hotel was well worth the 700Czk for an easy no hassle arrival from the airport.
reviews.title: A new Prague angle at Andels

likes.liked: — It's near great transport links and is modern and clean, breakfast is good quality.
likes.disliked: — Price of mini-bar water is a rip off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lobby was bright modern clean and airy. Check in was swift and easy on a Wednesday at 9pm.
reviews.title: New, modern, a perfect location for staying in Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 modern lifts (elevators) meant we never waited more than 30 seconds for one.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was pretty much faultless, again nice and clean and airy.
reviews.title: prague delights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Funny set up for toilet/shower I thought, they are both enclosed in glass cubicles so I guess one can go to the loo when someone is in the shower.
reviews.title: Great Suite, Great Breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Prague in the first week of March this year and stayed at the Andel's hotel. The location of the hotel is great - not right in the town centre, but at the same time just a few tram stops away. It is also very easy to get from the airport. It is much cheaper to get a day travel pass and use public transport than booking a taxi at the hotel (to compare - a 24hr travel pass valid for trams, buses and tubes costs 100Kc and a taxi from the hotel just to the airport 250Kc.)
reviews.title: Perfect location

likes.disliked: — The rooms were a little 'run down'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself has a nice design and a modern look but the rooms are a little 'run down'. The staff was very friendly, helpful and visible everywhere. The breakfast bar has a massive choice of literally everything.
reviews.title: nice new design hotel

likes.disliked: — 10 mins tram from city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Andel's hotel and would happily return there again by our next visit to this amazing city.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at Andel's Prague

likes.liked: — Complimentary services: full breakfast, bed slippers, free lattes
likes.disliked: — We could not move in permanently.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: we stayed in andel's for 2 nights during our visit to prague in Feb. upon our arrival, we were assigned an apartment insiead of a hotel room which i guess may due to the full booking of hotel rooms. this is even better as there are flat screen TVs and a living room and kitchen and 2 levels (with internal staircase), just for 2 of us. but a bit strange is the toilet and baths are separate in 2 rooms
reviews.title: Wow, I loved the Andels!

likes.liked: — The Location and the design of the hotel!
likes.disliked: — Not the accommodation, just beware of the pick pockets in Prague.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: in general, we like the design as it's new and trendy, which is comparatively different from other european hotels. the breakfast is nice, with all range of food including congee which can cater some ppl's needs.
reviews.title: Not bad; a little disappointed

likes.disliked: — rooms could have been cleaner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was great, stayed two nights. Very clean and crisp hotel, great bathroom although the toilet did smell a bit as the last guest had peed on the floor, I am assuming they decided to do the late checkout (at a small cost) after the room had been cleaned. However the next day the room was cleaned and it was fine. I booked a taxi with www.prague-airport-shuttle.com a wise move, very friendly and some great advise for getting around town. On arrival we asked if we could have a room with a bath and were upgraded to the fifth floor, so we did get a bath but this floor has a smoking area by the lift so is a bit smokey at times when you go up or down.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Shame about Prague?

likes.disliked: — The smell of wee in the bathroom on the first night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The staff were very attentive and courteous, the breakfast was a good selection, what you would expect if you had paid full price, but the usual fair - not sure why people thought it was 'amazing' it was good but the same as most hotels I have stayed in of a similar cost. The staff did tend to take your plate away just as you finished your last mouthful; it did make it feel a bit of a production line. Food around the hotel is mainly KFC, McDonalds and Tesco - however the saving grace is a very nice Japanese restaurant two mins around the corner from the hotel, not cheap about 1200 Crown (£30) for a good meal for two - the green tea is free though - Bonza! Eating in Prague is mainly Steak and Pizza on the streets the one (no joke) Mexican place to eat is good and about 600 Crown (£15 for two courses and a drink) - if you go to the old town you can get a riverside restaurant with good food but a good price and you need to book.
reviews.title: Neat design hotel
Beware Money changers in Prague
reviews.text: The hotel is about a mile from town, easy to buy a tram ticket from the Tabac shop for a day / three and use 9, 20 and 12 to get to the main spots (it's not a major walk either); mind you get the one going the right way though as we stayed on a number 9 thinking it would go in a loop but it didn't - we ended up about 3 miles out of town in the a hole of nowhere in an area of crumbling communist tower blocks - the real Prague I guess but a hop across the track and a 10 min wait got us back the right way.

reviews.title: Good hotel in Prague
reviews.text: As for Prague - we went for a wedding that was called off last minuet so took the choice of not loosing the money we had paid for flight, insurance, car park etc. I would not recommend March as a good time to go, the weather was fairly grey and cold, not much green about and some things were closed such as the funicular railway. On the Saturday (24th March) was a half marathon, some of the town was closed off, the evening had a Euro 2008 game against Germany - we avoided the town in the evening due to rowdy fans in the day - a good job as a bar was burnt out that night and a fight ensued in the old town.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel
reviews.text: As for Prague I found it way too commercialised for my liking, Tesco, Marks and Spenser, Debenhams, Next... WTF? Where did Prague go I thought, perhaps in a race to get things on track after communism big companies such as McDonalds do seem to have the biggest foot print and the most to gain and have thus taken some of the history away from the streets. As such I was left feeling that Prague was a cross between Oxford city and a Slough trading estate. I was lead to believe Prague was a city of romance and interesting architecture but sadly this was not quite the case. The city was full to bursting with tourists from every nation under the sun, including lots of school parties from France and Spain and this was off season so I cannot imagine what it would be like in June / July. Prague seems to be geared up for Stag doos to the n'th degree, we saw a lot of groups of UK 'lads' doing their bit to reassure other nations that Britt's abroad are the Morons of Europe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved Andel's Hotel - it is situated slightly out of the main city centre but is still within walking distance of all the main tourist sites in Prague - it is also only a minute away from the underground which is a very cheap and efficient way of getting round the city. It is also very close to a cinema, shopping centre and several eateries.
reviews.title: Stay at this hotel - it's fab!

likes.liked: — The luxurious swanky feel of the hotel
likes.disliked: — It isn't in the nicest area of Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The actual hotel itself is very new and modern - it is extremely clean and the staff were friendly and helpful - you could even buy transport tickets from them and they would change large denominations of currency (as some of the notes are worth £60+). Our room was really nice - big and quite luxurious and really comfortable. The best thing about the hotel is the enormous choice of food at the buffet breakfast (although wasn't too such about battered broccoli!) - every morning there was a great choice of cooked food, as well as cold meats and cheeses, cereals, bread, pastries, fruit, yoghurt and even cakes.
reviews.title: Great hotel,location

likes.disliked: — the unreasonable time the cleaners started

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay at this hotel again and now always look for an Andel's Hotel when I am booking city break hotels.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.disliked: — not much to dislike here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didnt arrive until 2130pm so didnt see much of the area that night.But we did manage to go to a Chinese restaurant five minutes up the road (bottle of beer and curry) - £5.Service wasnt great but meal beautiful.Then to TGIs nearby where we had great night.The hotel was modern and spacious.Our bathroom was something else - frosted glass doors and then separate closed off toilet within and speakers filtered through from bedroom.The breakfast was unbelievable - catered for every culture.We were about ten minutes in taxi from Prague centre but that was not problem as in our area there was a 150 (shop) mall which had Tesco and then next door McDoanlds,KFC and Pizza Express.There was a square with banks,restaurants and pubs.Staff were very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Top class hotel, in an excellent location

likes.liked: — Central location, access to all modes of transport around the corner, and also the hotel taxi airport pick up service
likes.disliked: — No bath/ poor selection of english speaking tv channels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 20 minutes walk from the Charles bridge, 100 m from a big shopping centre, cinema and restaurants, good service, nice clean room and lovely breakfast. Recommended!
reviews.title: Minimalists' heaven

likes.disliked: — bathroom design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is a new and very efficiently run hotel. Ideally suited to the business traveller. Clean and spacious room, very well furnished. Breakfast is the usual euro buffet style.
reviews.title: Pleasant, modern,comfortable, friendly.

likes.disliked: — No complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will definitely stay here on future trips to Prague.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second trip to Prague and our stay at Andels Hotel was just excellent.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — Immaculately clean, good food, staff and location
likes.disliked: — nothing, everything was so good!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel was very easy to find, we took the bus and then the metro from the airport costing approx 75p each, journey took about 45 minutes. A taxi ride would be about 20 minutes and £16.
reviews.title: Good location, ideal for business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very friendly on arrival, check in was quick and we easily found our room. Room was amazeing, lovely bed and bathroom with bath and seperate shower. The rooms also have a DVD player which was useful because I bought some DVDs from the TAX free shop at the airport on our journey out!
reviews.title: fantastic hotel

likes.liked: — I liked the design, location and definatley the price!
likes.disliked: — nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights during the middle of march and were recommended the hotel by family. We couldn't of asked for anything better, the hotel met and surpassed our expectations and allowed us to enjoy the city to the max.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great city

likes.liked: — Brilliant value for money, amazing rooms and brilliant breakfasts
likes.disliked: — Distance from tourist centre of Prague.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About a 20 min walk from the tourist centre of Prague or 5 mins on the local underground network, the hotel allowed us to see all aspects of Prague city life. The andel area is a developing business destrict, with plenty of shops, bars and restaurants to help you enjoy your trip whether it be business or pleasure.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Average Location

likes.liked: — Very modern and high spec throughout. Excellent service from all staff.
likes.disliked: — Location.

reviews.title: Well worth a look
reviews.text: The hotel was great, brilliant service, our deal included a fantastic continental breakfast, which filled us up for all the walking and sightseeing we had planned. Great rooms - very comfortable beds and I loved the bathrooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great hotel and brilliant value for money.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.disliked: — Nothing

reviews.title: Good value for money
reviews.text: Came to Prague for Valentines Day 06 with my fiancee. The hotel staff were outstanding and the room excellent, with an absolutely huge bed. As the other reviews say, the design is very modern without being tacky. For the money I was very impressed. The only thing stopping it being a five is the location. Although right next door to a large shopping centre, who goes to Prague to walk around shopping centres? It was the old city that we had gone to see and this was one heck of a walk; gorgeous scenery, but still quite a hike. Otherwise excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Andels in one of the suites on the 4th and 5th April 2007 as a suprise birthday trip.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — Some noise from streets during night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fantastic with large wall mounted plasma tv's in the living and bedrooms, a great bathroom with large bath and great shower and a chalet style kitchen.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom had twin beds rather than a double and the space and facilities were not something we used during the short stay, with eating out being so cheap.
reviews.title: Perfect!

likes.liked: — EVERYTHING!! and the way they folded the toliet paper into a triangle when they clean the room!!!
likes.disliked: — NOTHING! It was perfect in every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are some luxury touches such as electrically operated blinds on the windows and underfloor heating in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Good Modern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are staying as a family or a group of friends the fridge and dishwasher would be of more importance.
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel, perfect location for tourits

likes.disliked: — n/a

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having e-mailed the hotel direct we organised a driver to come to the airport to collect us, we found our driver easily and an enjoyable and informative drive direct to Andels followed. (Can be charged to room or paid directly to driver 700Kr).
reviews.title: a great hotel in a great city

likes.disliked: — Nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room spotless, slight problem with safe was speedily rectifed by member of reception staff who also helped us with travel information for travelling around the city.
reviews.title: Brilliant!!!!

likes.disliked: — Probably the distance from the centre of prague

reviews.title: Fabulous stay
reviews.text: For those staying longer than 3 days a 7 day travel ticket is the best value, these can be easily purchased at the newsagents around the corner from Andels. You take ticket and punch in machine either at metro station or on tram, this activates your ticket and you must retain for travel but do not require to stamp again, £1000 fine for not having a ticket, no excuses accepted.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Take a no. 20 or 12 to Malo Stranke which is beside St. Nicolas church, you cant miss it. From there it is a short walk to Charles Bridge and on to the old town.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, great location
Everything I hoped it would be!!
reviews.text: The area that Andels is situated in is a vibrant shopping and leisure area, it is ideal with plenty of restauants and shops and prices considerably less than in the old town. Would highly recommend the Plzensky Restaurant just opposite where the metro station is , for Czech food and beer, sharing a table is the norm,just ask "Are these seats free?", great atmosphere and very cheap.

description: The four-star deluxe Andel's Hotel & Suites Prague is a stylish designer choice for the perfect stay in the Czech Republic. The hotel is located close to Prague’s historical center, a few minutes to Andel metro and 20 minutes from Ruzyne Airport. Guest rooms and suites combine the highest standards of comfort with modern equipment. Successful meetings and conferences are the specialty of the hotel’s conference center.
